_comment: Created by ianb on 14/10/2013 11:38:59 using v0.9
title: Has the pattern of breaches changed between years?
analysis_commentary: For the first 16 months of the year, the proportion of patients waiting more than four hours for a bed following a decision to admit was 75% higher in 2013 compared to 2012, and 137% higher than in 2011. There are a number of potential explanations for this including: bad weather, increased complexity of patients, possible staff shortages and disruptions caused by the roll-out of the NHS 111 urgent care phone service. After April 2013 there was a slightly higher proportion of patients waiting more than four hours for a bed compared with the same period in previous years (13% higher in 2013 compared with 2012, and 33% higher in 2013 compared with 2011), but the difference is much less stark than the start of 2013
data_source: NHS England, A&E Waiting Times and Activity
